qas.question: What do some agriculturalists often do?
What do they sometimes do for entertainment?
Why would they leave agricultural lifestyle?
Besides avoiding government controls, what other reason could they have?
Others in undeveloped countries go hunting, primarily for what?
In the African rainforest, groups continue to rely on what?
Groups in what area have accepted colonial control?
Hunting is usually done in the frost-free what?

context: Some agriculturalists also regularly <a0_0><b4_0>hunt and gather<b4_0/><a0_0/> (e.g., farming during the frost-free <b8_0>season<b8_0/> and hunting during the winter). Still others in developed countries <a1_0>go hunting<a1_0/>, primarily for <b5_0>leisure<b5_0/>. In <b7_0>the Brazilian rainforest<b7_0/>, those groups that recently did, or even continue to, rely on <b6_0>hunting and gathering<b6_0/> techniques seem to have adopted this lifestyle, abandoning most agriculture, as a way <a2_0>to escape colonial control<a2_0/> and as a result of the introduction of European diseases reducing their populations to levels where <a3_0>agriculture became difficult<a3_0/>.[citation needed][dubious – discuss]
